text: um
hi everyone stoned any stone 10 over
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
baroness record Stone this is a new LP
from sludge and Stoner metal veterans
baroness who have been an operating
metal outfit for like two decades now
and this record arrives at an
interesting point in their catalog as
they're pretty well known for their
discography up until this point uh being
this color-coded series of albums blue
green yellow red purple their last kind
of double LP gold and gray was like a I
guess a a replacement for kind of doing
an orange album and I guess this new LP
uh sees the band kind of transitioning
out of this series maybe embarking on a
new chapter with stone but when I've
actually dug into the record I I don't
feel like what the band offered here
musically uh was super refreshing it
mostly just feels like a lesser version
of the vaguely heavy Prague that they've
been trying to sell us on for their past
couple of Records especially on gold and
gray where they did Cover a lot of
stylistic bases on that project
admirably but that LP also kind of saw
the band stretching themselves a bit too
thin creatively plus it didn't really
hold the candle to the electrifying
sludge the band came onto the scene with
in the mid-2000s on first glance though
Stone does look a lot more condensed
than golden gray there's no double album
bloat here or anything like that but
still this project does kind of lack the
punch that you would expect from a metal
record that rounds out at about 45
minutes whether it be because of weak
production like in the case of last word
where the vocal layering despite it
being stacked so high it falls so flat
plus the guitar solo on this track
sounds like it was recorded in a green
room shower stall so yeah weird
production choices and and also weak
songwriting ideas too like under the
wheel which is a moody number with some
fiery and heavily layered guitar
passages that are pretty spicy
definitely one of the more tingly sounds
in the mix on the entire record beyond
that I'm hearing a lot of a propulsive
riffs some manly shouty vocals calling
it into the Oblivion some expressive
drum fills too and these are all good
things which would be great additions to
a memorable song which is the issue with
this track I hear movement it feels like
the band is you know jamming together
pretty well they're going through the
motions effectively but there's not a
song at the core of this track that
brings it all together and kind of
leaves me with a memory of it so again
while in a sense there is uh somewhat of
a direction to what's going on there's
not really a destination in mind and of
course more forgettable writing and
questionable mixing crops up deeper into
the record there's choir which I love
the Flawless and tight transition from
the previous track into this one really
really kind of shows the band was
carrying at least a little bit about the
macro picture of this album and how
these songs came together overall but
for sure the dramatic narrations
drenched in these uh doubled up vocal
layers on this track sound horrible and
are just to put it bluntly obnoxious and
while I love that Anodyne does bring
some of the heaviest and chunkiest riffs
on the entire project the band
ultimately fails to pair these guitars
with a vocal melody or some leads that
really kind of feel like they stick out
whether that be just in a generally
catchy way or in a way that feels new
and I guess significant in baroness's
overall discography because you know
sadly the song does kind of serve as a
reminder that at one time the band did
like actually put out some hard-hitting
stuff you know around the red in blue
era but that's just not really the case
on this record sadly most of the
material in the final leg of this
project is just a tedious log and really
the only tracks that came out of this
album enjoying all the way through were
one the single beneath the rose which is
a great highlight on this project but
also kind of contributes to My overall
disappointment with the record because
while I do find it kind of surprising uh
that the band does this like 90s alt
metal thing on the track with their
guitar playing and also some of the
spoken word passages the multiple phases
within the song Tour kind of sick and
Progressive as well I like the Dynamics
and versatility of the track it really
feels like baroness is breaking
themselves out of their comfort zone on
this one and it's just kind of shocking
that uh much of the record doesn't
really follow this song's lead the band
really gave us the most daring moment on
the record as a single and again it's
just a little shocking and disappointing
to hear that they didn't want to
experiment more or try anything else all
that new for the rest of the album the
other track I got quite a a bit out of
on the project was miraculously the
acoustic closer which is a super gentle
unassuming folksy ballad with some great
soft gentle dreamy vocal harmonies some
decent lyrics too I mean it serves as a
cool little Oasis at the end of the
record kind of surprising but yeah one
of my favorite moments on this metal
album ended up being like you know the
acoustic outro and overall I'm just kind
of at a loss with this one honestly it
feels like baroness attempted to launch
a new uh Direction a new something here
but they just kind of ended up repeating
themselves a little bit and failing to
make a lot of these new ideas sound
exciting it's got me worrying if from
this point are we just going to continue
seeing uh diminishing returns from the
band's work as they push forward I'm
feeling a strong four to a light five on
this one transition have you given this
album a listen did you love it did you
hate it what would you rate it you're
the best you're the best what should I
review next hit the like if you like
Please Subscribe and please don't cry
hit the Bell as well over here next to
my head is another video you can check
out hit that up or the link to subscribe
to the channel Anthony fantano baroness
forever
